Page.Value: To constantly monitor outstanding Problems with regards to their processing status, so that where necessary corrective measures may be introduced.

System Version No

Prop.Name: sys_Description
Prop.Value: The Problem Manager is responsible for managing the lifecycle of all Problems. His primary objectives are to prevent Incidents from happening, and to minimize the impact of Incidents that cannot be prevented. To this purpose he maintains information about Known Errors and Workarounds.
Prop.Label: Description

Shape.Name: Annotation.70
Shape.Text: Measures for acceleration or escalation required

Prop.Name: sys_Description
Prop.Value: The Known Error Database (KEDB) is created by Problem Management and used by Incident and Problem Management to manage all Known Error Records.
Prop.Label: Description

Prop.Name: sys_Description
Prop.Value: The Problem Record contains all details of a Problem, documenting the history of the Problem from detection to resolution.
Prop.Label: Description

Shape.Name: Sheet.143
Shape.Text: Process Objective: To constantly monitor outstanding Problems with regards to their processing status, so that where necessary corrective measures may be introduced.

Prop.Name: Note
Prop.Value: The Problem Record contains all details of a Problem, documenting the history of the Problem from detection to resolution.
Prop.Label: Note

Prop.Name: sys_Description

Prop.Name: sys_Description
Prop.Value: The Problem Record contains all details of a Problem, documenting the history of the Problem from detection to resolution.
Prop.Label: Description

Prop.Name: Note
Prop.Value: A problem that has a documented root cause and a workaround. Known Errors are created and managed throughout their lifecycle by Problem Management. Known Errors may also be identified by development or suppliers.
Prop.Label: Note

Prop.Name: sys_Description
Prop.Value: A problem that has a documented root cause and a workaround. Known Errors are created and managed throughout their lifecycle by Problem Management. Known Errors may also be identified by development or suppliers.
Prop.Label: Description

Prop.Name: Note
Prop.Value: Reducing or eliminating the impact of an Incident or Problem for which a full resolution is not yet available, for example by restarting a failed Configuration Item. Workarounds for Problems are documented in Known Error records.
Prop.Label: Note

Prop.Name: sys_Description
Prop.Value: Reducing or eliminating the impact of an Incident or Problem for which a full resolution is not yet available, for example by restarting a failed Configuration Item. Workarounds for Problems are documented in Known Error records.
Prop.Label: Description

Prop.Name: sys_Description
Prop.Value: To identify the underlying root cause of a Problem and initiate the most appropriate and economical Problem solution. If possible, a temporary Workaround is supplied.
Prop.Label: Description

Prop.Name: sys_Description
Prop.Value: To record and prioritize the Problem with appropriate diligence, in order to facilitate a swift and effective resolution.
Prop.Label: Description

Prop.Value: To constantly monitor outstanding Problems with regards to their processing status, so that where necessary corrective measures may be introduced.
Prop.Label: Description
